chinese: rational thoughts, decisions, etc. are based on reasons rather than emotions （想法、决定等）合理的，基于理性的
examples: e.g. Parents need to be fully informed before they can make a [[rational]] decision.

chinese: relating to the natural processes performed by living things 生物的；与生物有关的
examples: e.g. Breathing and sleeping are examples of [[biological]] rhythms in humans.

chinese: relating to genes or genetics 基因的；遗传学的
examples: e.g. I'm giving a seminar on the latest developments in [[genetic]] research next week.

chinese: [C] an extremely small living thing which can only be seen if you use a microscope. Some microbes can cause diseases. 微生物
examples: e.g. Was it not the duty of the doctor to kill the [[microbes]]?

chinese: very silly or unreasonable 愚蠢的；荒唐的；可笑的
examples: e.g. It's [[ridiculous]] that we have to wait two weeks for the operation.

chinese: in a way that is based on feelings rather than facts or proof 基于直觉地
examples: e.g. She had sensed, [[intuitively]], that Larry was interested in her.

chinese: in a way that shows you are happy or pleased to do sth. or that you do not object to doing sth. 欣然地；愿意地；乐意地
examples: e.g. Sixty percent of voters said they would [[willingly]] pay higher taxes for better health care.

chinese: [U] 西兰花
move your body quickly away from sb. / sth. because you find them or it frightening or unpleasant 退缩；畏缩
examples: e.g. Howard [[recoiled]] a little at the sharpness in my voice.

chinese: [U] a feeling of great shock, fear, or disgust 震惊；惊恐；厌恶
examples: e.g. The thought of being left alone filled her with [[horror]].

chinese: [U] a feeling that sb. / sth. is unpleasant or morally offensive 不喜欢；厌恶；反感
examples: e.g. She was trying her best not to show her [[distaste]].

chinese: [C, U] a difference between similar things, or a change from the usual amount or form of sth. （相似物体之间的）差异；（数量或形式的）变化，变动
examples: e.g. There might be striking [[variations]] within a species.

chinese: [C, usu. pl.] 味蕾
[C] a nerve ending which receives information about changes in light, heat, etc. and causes the body to react in particular ways 感受器；受体
examples: e.g. In the year 2000, taste [[receptors]] that detect this chemical were discovered on the tongue.

chinese: [U] 硫脲
more than enough in quantity 丰富的；充足的
examples: e.g. I provided a [[plentiful]] supply of games to keep the children occupied.

chinese: [U] (deoxyribonucleic acid) 脱氧核糖核酸
extremely unpleasant and making you feel sick 令人恶心的；使人极其反感的；令人厌恶的
examples: e.g. The kitchen was in a [[disgusting]] state when she left.

chinese: fair, practical, and sensible 有道理的；合情合理的
examples: e.g. Be [[reasonable]] — you can't expect her to do all the work on her own!

chinese: reduce sb.'s pain or unpleasant feelings 减轻；缓解（疼痛或不快的感觉）
examples: e.g. This kind of drug can help to [[relieve]] the pain, but it should be used carefully.

chinese: feeling happy because you are no longer worried about sth. 宽慰的；放心的
examples: e.g. She looked immensely [[relieved]] when she heard the news.

chinese: an innate quality or ability is sth. you are born with （素质或能力）天生的，与生俱来的
examples: e.g. Children seem to have an [[innate]] ability to learn language.

chinese: 1) sexually attractive 性感迷人的
examples: e.g. He was with the young woman whom his classmates thought most [[desirable]].；e.g. The ability to speak a foreign language is highly [[desirable]].

chinese: 2) (fml.) sth. that is desirable is worth having or doing 理想的；值得拥有的；值得做的
examples: e.g. He was with the young woman whom his classmates thought most [[desirable]].；e.g. The ability to speak a foreign language is highly [[desirable]].

chinese: 1) [C] (infml.) a husband, wife, or other sexual partner 丈夫；妻子；配偶；性伴侣
examples: e.g. Many matchmaking sites compile lists of potential [[mates]] using basic information.；e.g. Some of my office [[mates]] are planning to throw a party for me.

chinese: 2) [C] sb. you work with, do an activity with, or share sth. with 同事；同伴
examples: e.g. Many matchmaking sites compile lists of potential [[mates]] using basic information.；e.g. Some of my office [[mates]] are planning to throw a party for me.

chinese: (esp. of a woman or part of her body) having an attractive or well-proportioned shape （尤指女子或其部分身体）好看的，匀称的
examples: e.g. She was about my age and had long, [[shapely]] legs and a beautiful smile.

chinese: shining and flashing with light 闪亮的；闪光的
examples: e.g. This is a region of [[sparkling]] lakes, rushing streams, and dense forests.

chinese: very pleasing in appearance or sound 好看的；好听的；有吸引力的
examples: e.g. I thought he was very [[attractive]] and obviously very intelligent.

chinese: relating to the way in which plants and animals develop and change gradually over a long period of time 进化的
examples: e.g. Some scholars are keen to see [[evolutionary]] theory challenged in university lecture halls.

chinese: if an animal or plant reproduces, or reproduces itself, it produces young plants or animals 生殖；繁殖
examples: e.g. Many single cell organisms [[reproduce]] by splitting in two.

chinese: relating to being a parent and esp. to being responsible for a child's safety and development 父亲的；母亲的；父母的
examples: e.g. [[Parental]] consent is required before the operation can take place.

chinese: [C] (pl. offspring) sb.'s child or children — often used humorously （某人的）子女，子孙，后代（常为幽默用法）
examples: e.g. Tom's sister came over on Saturday with all her [[offspring]].

chinese: [U] a lack of interest 无兴趣
examples: e.g. The exception to Tom’s [[disinterest]] in social issues was education.

chinese: [C] 器官
making you lose hope and determination 令人灰心的；令人气馁的
examples: e.g. It is [[disheartening]] to see what little progress has been made.

chinese: (not before noun) seeming certain to happen at some time in the future 注定的；必然的
examples: e.g. He feels that he is [[destined]] to become a musician, just like his father.

chinese: 1) (be a ~ of / to sth.) be so strongly influenced by sth. that you cannot make your own decisions — used to show disapproval 成为某事物的奴隶，完全受某事物控制（含贬义）
examples: e.g. How can she not see that she has become a [[slave]] of fashion?；e.g. By the time I was 10, I had become her [[slave]], doing all the housework.

chinese: 2) sb. who is owned by another person and works for them for no money 奴隶
examples: e.g. How can she not see that she has become a [[slave]] of fashion?；e.g. By the time I was 10, I had become her [[slave]], doing all the housework.

chinese: extremely attractive and impressive; deserving praise 壮丽的；宏伟的；值得赞扬的
examples: e.g. I think he deserves congratulations for a [[magnificent]] job well done.

chinese: deal with a problem or improve a bad situation 解决；补救；纠正；改善
examples: e.g. To [[remedy]] the situation, the water must be chemically treated.；e.g. There is no simple [[remedy]] for unemployment.

chinese: [C] a way of dealing with a problem or making a bad situation better （问题的）解决方式；（糟糕状况的）补救方法
examples: e.g. To [[remedy]] the situation, the water must be chemically treated.；e.g. There is no simple [[remedy]] for unemployment.

chinese: [U] a strong feeling of sympathy for sb. who is suffering, and a desire to help them 怜悯；同情
examples: e.g. He was filled with overwhelming love and [[compassion]] for his wife.

chinese: if sth. makes sense, there seems to be a good reason or explanation for it 解释得通；有道理
examples: e.g. Why did she do a thing like that? It doesn't seem to [[make sense]].

chinese: try to find out about sth. unknown or secret 探究；探寻
examples: e.g. When you [[dig into]] the data a bit though, things look gloomier.

chinese: have an idea or discover sth. suddenly or unexpectedly 突然想出（主意）；无意中发现（某事）
examples: e.g. When we first [[hit upon]] the idea, everyone told us it would never work.

chinese: start to love sb. very much 爱上某人
examples: e.g. The minute we met I knew this was the girl I wanted to give my heart to.

chinese: concerning sb. / sth. 关于某事
examples: e.g. Frank was very uncertain [[as to]] whether it was the right job for him.

chinese: very unhappy because sb. has sth. that you want 十分忌妒的；眼红的
examples: e.g. Chad is heading off to Spain for the week, and I'm [[green with envy]].

chinese: start doing sth. or making plans to do sth. in order to achieve a particular result （为达到某个结果而）开始做某事，着手进行
examples: e.g. He has achieved what he [[set out to do]] three years ago.

chinese: (spoken) if sb. says they are on the case, they know about a problem and are going to try to solve it 负责处理某事；负责解决某事
examples: e.g. "We need to book a flight before it's too late." "Don't worry, I'm [[on the case]]."

chinese: used to say sth. is impossible for sb. to control 无法控制
examples: e.g. There was nothing we could do about it — the situation was beyond our control.

chinese: support sb. / sth. 给予支持
examples: e.g. The president is [[lending support]] to the governor's re-election campaign.

chinese: get upset by the things other people say or do, because you think that their remarks or behaviors are directed at you in particular 因认为某人的言行针对自己而不快
examples: e.g. Don't [[take it personally]]; she is rude to everyone.
